attributes.action: Rename the NHS The ROYAL National Health Service
attributes.additional_details: Most of us are guilty of taking our NHS for granted but at this time of an unprecedented world wide health emergency many of us are turning out every Thursday evening to join together in showing how much we actually value and care about our NHS. Eventually, once the emergency is over, this nationwide weekly acolade will probably cease. Granting the NHS the style of ROYAL will be an acolade which will never cease, a permanent reminder of the value we as a nation place upon this vital body.
attributes.background: Petition HM The Queen to grant the style and status of Royal to the NHS

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The title ‘Royal’ is a privilege granted by the Queen and not by the Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to recommend to Her Majesty that she grant the title "Royal" to the NHS.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
